BodyCopy.p:
Captive legislation has advanced in both the Texas House and the Texas Senate.
HB 1700 was recently considered in public hearing by the Texas House Insurance Committee. Josh Magden, Texas Captive Insurance Association (TxCIA) board president, testified at the hearing in favor of the bill.
SB 667 received unanimous support in the Texas Senate Business and Commerce Committee for being placed on the Local and Uncontested Calendar.
Both HB 1700 and SB 667:

ol.li: Provide reinsurance pooling as an option to allow captives to introduce third-party risk to insure deductibility of premium
Give discretion to the Texas Department of Insurance (TDI) in determining when credit for reinsurance will be granted
Require the TDI be given notice when a captive declares dividends

BodyCopy.p:
Assuming SB 667 passes the Senate, the bill will go to the House and be referred to House Insurance where HB 1700 is pending. TxCIA representatives have said there may be the opportunity to introduce a House committee substitute for SB 667 in House Insurance, provided language can be worked out to expand credit for reinsurance to commercial reinsurers, authorize reciprocals, transfer incorporation of captives from the Secretary of State's Office to the Department of Insurance, and finally clarify some investment options for captives.
